question: Which country houses the "Valley of Sula"?
explanation: The Valley of Sula is the largest alluvial valley of Honduras. It is located in the northwest of the country, and within it lie several of Honduras's most important cities. This area has two of the most important basins of Honduras: the basins of the Ulua and Chamelecon rivers, leaving the area vulnerable to flooding, mainly in the rainy season. The valley's ecosystem is mainly composed of tropical dry forests.
